task.summary: So, this is the initial commit of the CreateSystemViaPost code, meant to be an example for users to follow
Added some try/except logic, as well as more comments.
Added more comments; shifted assignment of authorizationCode into the 'else' clause (after access)
Added main routine & call to subroutine based on __name__ == '__main__'
Fixed some more commenting, after moving all processing to createSystem() and all parsing logic in the main routine
Since I'm getting errors on POSTing system info, trying different things. Apparently, neeed to talk to one of the engineers -- something I don't understand, apparently.
Most recent 'flailings' in trying to POST a system to Plutora. Most recently, getting 'The request is invalid, an error has occurred'
During the POST, I was using a string, but not necessarily a JSONized string. This time I converted it via json.loads() [still get the same error, tho]

FINALLY got Plutora to accept a POST. In this instance, I created a System via POST. Turns out that the 'magic handshake' is either to include the (supposedly optional) "additionalInformation" key or to create a custom field (in Customization/Systems). Then the POST will properly complete [turns out that the custom field doesn't even have to be referenced in the POST, just to exist within the system]
fixed file-format to match other programs (client_id vs clientId, etc)
Changed the output from 'pp.pprint(r.json())'' to 'r.encoding="ISO-8559-1";print(json.loads(json.dumps(r.text)))'. This allows piping directly into a JSON-extraction tool like 'jq'.

MESSAGE.value: So, this is the initial commit of the CreateSystemViaPost code, meant to be an example for users to follow
Added some try/except logic, as well as more comments.
Added more comments; shifted assignment of authorizationCode into the 'else' clause (after access)
Added main routine & call to subroutine based on __name__ == '__main__'
Fixed some more commenting, after moving all processing to createSystem() and all parsing logic in the main routine
Since I'm getting errors on POSTing system info, trying different things. Apparently, neeed to talk to one of the engineers -- something I don't understand, apparently.
Most recent 'flailings' in trying to POST a system to Plutora. Most recently, getting 'The request is invalid, an error has occurred'
During the POST, I was using a string, but not necessarily a JSONized string. This time I converted it via json.loads() [still get the same error, tho]

FINALLY got Plutora to accept a POST. In this instance, I created a System via POST. Turns out that the 'magic handshake' is either to include the (supposedly optional) "additionalInformation" key or to create a custom field (in Customization/Systems). Then the POST will properly complete [turns out that the custom field doesn't even have to be referenced in the POST, just to exist within the system]
fixed file-format to match other programs (client_id vs clientId, etc)
Changed the output from 'pp.pprint(r.json())'' to 'r.encoding="ISO-8559-1";print(json.loads(json.dumps(r.text)))'. This allows piping directly into a JSON-extraction tool like 'jq'.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Changed the output from 'pp.pprint(r.json())'' to 'r.encoding="ISO-8559-1";print(json.loads(json.dumps(r.text)))'. This allows piping directly into a JSON-extraction tool like 'jq'.
